p: C. maculatus mortality from V. arborea essential oil was lower than that of its major component α-bisabolol in almost all concentrations except for 1.2, 1.6, and 11.2 μL L −1 air, which were similar to each other. The α-bisabolol was more efficient and caused higher C. maculatus mortality in five of the eight concentrations tested (2.0 to 8.4 μL L −1 of air) (Table 2). When analyzing the mortality of male and females of C. maculatus, it was noticed that the mortality of males at concentrations of 1.2, 1.6, and 8.4 μL L −1 air was similar between V. arborea essential oil and its major constituent. α-Bisabolol was more toxic to male at the other concentrations. On the other hand, the female mortality with V. arborea essential oil and α-bisabolol was similar in low (1.2 and 1.6 μL L −1 of air) and high concentrations (5.6, 8.4, and 11.2 μL L −1 air). α-Bisabolol were more toxic to female at the other concentrations (Table 3).
